title: 111_hr4339
content: The Act is named the "Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Act" and establishes a fellowship program for students from the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. The "Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program" established by the Secretary of the Interior awards local and Federal government fellowships to qualified students from the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. The program includes local government and Federal fellowships for internships in relevant agencies or entities. The "Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program" offers internships in Executive agencies, Congressional offices, or with Representatives/Senators. The fellowship term is a semester or summer, with a stipend of $6,000 for a semester internship. The "Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program" offers internships in Executive agencies, Congressional offices, or with Representatives/Senators with a stipend of $6,000 for a semester internship. For a summer fellowship, participants receive $4,000. Starting from fiscal year 2010, the dollar amounts are adjusted annually based on the Consumer Price Index. The "Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program" offers internships with a stipend based on the Consumer Price Index. The Secretary may provide a travel stipend of up to $1,500 for each fellowship term to qualified students. The Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program, established under the Higher Education Act of 1965, involves an application and selection process for awarding fellowships. Priority is given to students who have completed either a local government fellowship or a Federal fellowship. Fellows are not assigned to internships in agencies or offices that do not meet certain criteria. The Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program requires agencies or offices to provide fellows with opportunities for professional development, job skill training, networking, and community service activities. Each student is limited to one local government fellowship and one Federal fellowship. The Secretary must report to Congress on the program's use of funds within 3 years of enactment. The Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program focuses on the use of appropriated funds and barriers to participation. Definitions include the Consumer Price Index and a fellow as a student awarded a fellowship. $1,000,000 is authorized for the program in fiscal year 2010. The Secretary shall allocate funds for the Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Fellowship Program, starting with $1,000,000 for fiscal year 2010 and necessary amounts for subsequent years. A minimum of 5-10% of the appropriated funds, but not less than $50,000, will be reserved for program activities.
